episode_event_timeattack_ch0257_00_qiban:
[Name:PlayerNickname ] agreed to do some
special training with Raihan.

Raihan and Duraludon’s ability to make quick
decisions wasn’t all that was surprising
about them...

Bring the storm! My partner Pokémon will send
everyone in the time trial flying!

All right! Looks like I’m getting better at this timed
battle thing!

I bet you two are tired, too, huh. Let’s take a
little break, then.
You were really fired up!

I was, wasn’t I! I suppose I couldn’t help myself,
what with Leon in the top spot and all.
You were like a dragon yourself!

You think so? I suppose I did get a little fired up,
but I’m rather serious about beating Leon.

He’s not just the Champion of Galar—he’s also
my rival.

Well, I call him my rival, but I’ve never actually
beaten him in an official match back in Galar.

All my selfies after we’ve battled are just pictures
of me losing. What a drag, eh? Wanna see some
of them?

What do you think? I still look good even when I
lose, don’t I?
But you beat most other people!

Yeah! Awesome, isn’t it? They don’t call me the
strongest Gym Leader in Galar for nothing!
Leon’s the only one you can’t beat?

Well, to tell you the truth, there is one other
Trainer I can’t beat. She’s a Gym Leader who
uses Ice types...

Anyway, I’ve never been able to beat Leon in
an official battle back in Galar.

But I’ll definitely take him down here in Pasio’s
time trials!

It also seems like Leon’s got something new in the
works these days...

I don’t know the details, but I do know that he’s
hoping to use his experience here on Pasio to do
something new back in Galar.

That’s why I’ve decided to give it my all here, too.
Whatever he tries to do, I’ve gotta do even better!
I’m cheering for you!

Hey, thanks! Let’s snap a quick selfie together to
commemorate my newest fan...
You’ll have to get a good time, then!

You’ve got that right. I can’t just give this a
halfhearted attempt. I’ve got to give it my all!

Right! I suppose it’s about time to get back to
training. Next up...
Hey! Raihan!
Hm? I know that voice...

Gloria! I knew it was you! And you’ve also got
Piers with you? What brings you two here?

Same thing as you, Raihan! We’re training for the
time trials!
I actually invited Marnie to train with me, but...

Why the long face? Something happen
with Marnie?
Oh, no. She just turned me down is all.

It’s all right. I’ll just keep singin’. Singin’ my
humble songs...
Uhh...Piers? You OK?
Oh... Hello, Gloria.

Let me sing you a new song. I call it “Ballad of
the Sad Older Brother.”

As I sang my sad song, Gloria offered to come out
and train with me.
Dramatic as ever, I see.
But great timing! Why don’t you two join us?
Really?! We’d love to!

I’d rather not show my hand if I can help it, but I
guess we’ve got no choice, huh.
Go get ’em, Zacian!
You’ve gotta be faster than that, Gloria!
Wha—?!
Gloria!

You don’t have time to be worrying about your
teammate, Piers!
Tch... Guess I wasn’t able to defend in time.
Sheesh. You beat me yet again.
Duraludon was so fast!

Indeed. These two make it rather clear that you
can’t judge anyone by appearances.
That was even faster than our battle!

It looks like Duraludon may be getting pretty good
at these time trial battles himself!
Duraludon’s way lighter than it appears!
It only weighs 88.2 pounds!

Nice one, Gloria! I can see you’ve really been
studying your Pokédex!
Hehe!

Let me teach you a little somethin’ as well while
we’re at it.

I hear that the Duraludon in Galar often fight with
the Tyranitar that inhabit the same territory.

Guess you could say they’re rivals. It might be
worthwhile to have your Duraludon battle a
Tyranitar for a little experience.

Hey, that’s not a bad idea. You might be onto
something there, Piers.

Do you know of any high-profile sync pairs on
Pasio with a Tyranitar for a partner?
I do!
Really? Great!
A sync pair with a Tyranitar...

Hmm... How about that one fellow who has
rock-hard willpower?

Sounds like you’ve got someone in mind.
[Name:PlayerNickname ], lead the way.
I can’t wait for this battle!

I guess Tyranitar is a better training partner for
Steelix than Onix after all.

It seems like Steelix is better at taking hits and
counterattacking than trying to quickly dodge them.

Yes! Even though Steelix evolves from Onix, the
fighting styles that suit them are different.

If we can train your Steelix to withstand
Tyranitar’s attacks, you’ll be able to go toe-to-toe
with any opponent!

Well said! That’s the sort of measured, intelligent
commentary I’d expect from one of Kanto’s
Gym Leaders.
Uh... Who are you again?

The name’s Raihan. I’m a Gym Leader from Galar
who uses Dragon-type Pokémon.

I’ve actually come to see if my Duraludon can spar
with your Tyranitar to train for the time trials.

[Name:PlayerNickname ] here has told me all
about you.
Ah, I see.

Well then, let me formally introduce myself! I’m
Brock, a Rock-type Gym Leader!
Were you training with Jasmine?

Yeah, we’re training for the time trials, too! I’ll let
my training partner here introduce herself.
What about Jasmine?

Whoops! You’re right. She needs to introduce
herself, too!

Hello. I’m a Gym Leader from Johto. My specialty
Pokémon type is...
Clang!
The Steel type!
Whoa. What was that all about?

Actually, could you do that again? I’ve gotta snap
a selfie to remember that by!
Wha—?! N-no! Absolutely not!
Camera shy, huh? Shame.
All right, Raihan. Shall we get started?

Tyranitar is unusually worked up right now.
I haven’t seen him like this in a while.

That’s great! My own partner’s been nagging me
to hurry this along and let him battle since we
got here!

Wow! Both Pokémon are really eager to battle
each other!

In Galar, these two Pokémon are rivals in the
wild, Brock! Let’s have them cut loose!

My Tyranitar isn’t from Galar, though. I guess it’s
just the nature of our Pokémon!
Here we go, Tyranitar!
He’s fast... Slow him down with rocks!

Bring the storm! My Duraludon will send you and
your rocks flying!

You’re not getting away that easily! Bombard the
area with rocks, Tyranitar!
That was close...but we dodged your rocks!
What?!

Let’s do it... The dragon roars! Time for our
sync move!

Well done! I can tell you’ve been training
for speed!

That was a close one! We were getting rather
desperate there towards the end!

What a great battle! Let’s snag a sweet selfie
together to commemorate this, Brock!
Sure thing!

Hey, I have an idea. Why don’t you battle
Jasmine next?
Jasmine is a Steel-type Pokémon expert!

She may be able to teach you a thing or two
about trainin’ your Duraludon more effectively.

I was just thinking the same thing! How about
it, Jasmine?

S-sure! But first, I have something I’d like to ask
of you...
What is it?
P-please let me polish your Duraludon!

What? That’s all? Of course you can! Give him a
good shine!

He’s had a lot of battles today and got a little
dirty. I’m sure he’d love a good polish.

Thank you! Hold still, Duraludon. I’ll get you
polished up right away!

[Name:PlayerNickname ] and [EN:Gen Ref="255" M="his" F="her" ] friends
continued their training.

Hey, everybody! Let’s take a selfie together to
commemorate this training session!
All right! I got a good one!
I hope this training pays off for you!

Me too! The great Raihan’s gotta blast past
Leon’s record!
Do you think you can beat Leon?
That’s the plan!

Now, all that’s left to do is to take on the time
trials for real. I’m coming for you, Leon!
Several days later...

Hey, [Name:PlayerNickname ]! Did you hear?
Raihan beat Leon’s record!

When we all return to Galar, we may finally be
entering the era of Champion Raihan!
Wh-what?!
Was that Raihan just now?

You’ve gotta be kidding! That’s way too fast!
It’s unreal!

Charizard and I got really fired up when we heard
that you’d beaten our record!

Thanks, though! That made the time trials even
more fun!
Raihan, don’t tell me...
Yeah, Leon went and beat my record.
Oh no...
W-well, I hope you don’t get too down about it—
Heh...
Hahahaha!
Wh-what?! What happened, Raihan?!

This is great! Just great! It wouldn’t be any fun if
you let me beat you THAT easily!

I’ll just have to beat your record again! I’ll do it
as many times as it takes!
Prepare yourself for a real challenge, Leon!
I’m looking forward to it, Raihan!

We’ve got to work hard as well so we can catch
up with those two!
